Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2011 03:20PM artiecat wrote: I had 6 tx of TAC then a lumpectomy and Axillary node dissection on August 29.  Now, because of path report, they want me to have a mx followed by radiation and more chemo.  Anyone have similar experience?  Very discouraged.
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2011 01:26PM artiecat wrote: In case your hospital didnt give you one, the American Cancer Society has a booklet with breast exercises after surgery.  You can order it on their website...or the hospital should have copies as well.  Very useful.
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2018 12:37AM artiecat wrote: Thanks, all. Actually I was a hospice social worker years ago, don't know why I can't get my head around the palliative part. I guess I just don't feel that my sx are enough to merit it. I have all my end of life paperwork in order, and I have plenty of support from family and friends. Part of the dilemma is that I live in Palm Springs and my doc is 2 hrs away where I used to live (health care here in the desert is not optimal). When it comes time that I am not able to manage on my own I will have to move over to my dtr's home, which is near the doc. It just doesn't make sense to me to start with a palliative team out here when I will be moving (which is a whole other issue). Appreciative your input, folks! I guess I am making some fairly simple decisions too complicated! And, I really didn't think I would still be putting along seven months after stopping all tx! (Nor did anyone else!) Just goes to show...LOL!
Posts.Title: Move on to palliative care? artiecat artiecat

Posts.Content: artiecat wrote: So...I have been out of active treatment for mets to bone and extensive lymph involvement for 7 months. (Somehow I am still here!) Not many sx except for periodic bouts of bone pain and general weakness. (Graduated to using a walker for morning walk last week!) Recently discomfort in belly, increase in lymphadenopathy in neck, which is impacting swallowing to some extent. Also painful shoulder from cancer in teres muscle. My onc has ordered a CT and has made a referral to palliative care. I don't feel I am ready for PC, but as I have been thinking about this, I realize the oncs are really for those in active tx. Thoughts? Dx 2/15/2011, ILC, 5cm, Stage IV, 7/10 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 4/2016, Stage IV, metastasized to bone/other Chemotherapy Taxol (paclitaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Move on to palliative care? artiecat artiecat

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2018 04:11PM artiecat wrote: pajim - happily I was in Vermont for most of last summer when was so hot! Yes, good idea. Thanks!
Posts.Title: Move on to palliative care? artiecat artiecat

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 07:11PM artiecat wrote: This is an AWESOME thread!  I start TAC next week and all these comments and hits are very wlecome!  I have read many (waaay toooo many!) bits of info on the process...this is great for tying it all together and getting down to the basics!!!  Thanks!!!  Hopefully I will have some hints to add!
Posts.Title: In retrospect, what do you wish you knew before starting chemo? jamiebeth jamiebeth

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2011 06:41PM artiecat wrote: Gosh - I didnt realize that the neo adjuvent chemo lasted for 6 months!  Yikes...is there an end to this?  Pamela aka Survivor in Training
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2011 09:03PM artiecat wrote: Well girls,  Had PET scan today as well as MD appt.  The news is that I am stage IIIc so they want to be a bit more aggressive...so I will start chemo first then surgery.  I am sticking with you at least until I know that my surgery will NOT be in April.   Today was the hardest day I have had.  I didnt plan on this!!!!  (We all know about plans!!!) Pamela
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2011 12:41AM artiecat wrote: I have worked with clients who can't stay away from researching on the internet - and now I am doing  the same thing!!!!  I feel like the reading  have done has helped me at least get to know the lingo so when the docs talk it isnt complrtely foreign. But it is overwhelming and scary!!!  Tomorrow I have a breakfast event with a group I belong to (lots of women) and I dread seeing that LOOK on their faces!
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2011 12:13AM artiecat wrote: Hi Becky, I used to work for San Diego Hospice as a medical social worker....learned a lot about disease process.   Sorry to welcome you to the Club!!! Pamela
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2011 08:28PM artiecat wrote: Okay - try not to laugh...I have two doc appts this week - and I know many more tests and appts to come during this trek...so I made myself an exam top!  It is a pink flower pattern with green grosgrain ribbon ties!!!!  Am I going to be the fashionista of the exam rom or what!!!!!!  Okay - I am pitiful!!!!  But it was fun and made me feel I was taking an action for MYSELF to feel better! Hope your day has been a god one!!!! Pamela
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 03:00PM artiecat wrote: sorry you qualify for this group, Robyn!  I was scheduled for mx in April, but they have decided to start with chemo, so my surgery is put off for a while.  Nancy and Randi have told me I can stick with them, though!  Went to surgeon this morning and he basically gave me a pep talk about the newer findings and the plan for chemo first.  Randi and Nancy - did the chemo help?  Did the tumor shrink much?  I have lots of naughty nodes  they want to get rid of - did you have that and did the chemo help with that? The one disappointment of the day:  he didnt examine me so I couldnt wear my new glam exam top!  Onco tomorrow for the plan!  Live and enjoy!!!  Pamela
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2011 11:30PM artiecat wrote: Hi Ladies, I am an April 6 girl too!  Still in the testing mode...not sure at this exact moment whether it will be uni or bi mx.  Went for breast mri today - machine broke half way through!  Tons o' fun, right!  I am not doing reconstruction!  Yes, let's hope these weeks pass quickly!!!! Pamela
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2011 08:30PM artiecat wrote: Ugh!!! I am okay, went in to work this morning - late because I had decided to just take to my bed for the day - well THAT is certainly boring!  Showed up at work - my two teammates plus another counselor plus our supervisor were all in our office - somebody said something nice to me and I started to cry.  I am okay as long as no one is nice to me!!  Thanks for asking - anxious to get to my doc appts next week to get the specifics on my game plan.
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2011 06:12PM artiecat wrote: Actually it went fine.  I got lots of hugs and only got a little tearful once.  One person wanted to tell me all the horrible stuff that had happened to her family.  There's always one!  And I only go t "the look"  a couple of times.  THe tearful moment was when a friend (who survived all this herself!) said - "Just remember one thing: whatever decision you make is the right one."  I am already tired of hearing how brave and strong I am - that is awful to say because really what else can they say?  But I too feel scared to death! The worst thing is that my supposed best friend has disappeared...no calls no nothing in over ten days.  Pretty disappointing.  Sending my best thoughts and wishes to you guys, Pamela
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 06:09PM artiecat wrote: Thanks for the info Randi and Nancy!  Randi -- ugh!  Sorry to hear you have to reschedule.  I think the waiting is so hard...and this process seems to be all about waiting! It is interesting for me to be in this place - several of the veterans in my program have had cancer and treatment.  Gives me a whole new view of what it is like for them! Check ya later!!!!!!  Pamela
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2011 12:47PM artiecat wrote: Hi  - havent been here for a bit - since I am starting with chemo, I have moved over to their thread.  I go today for a bone biopsy and port placement - - yikes!!!!  Randi, What does ALND mean?  Cheers to all!  Pamela
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2011 01:02PM artiecat wrote: Hi Nancy and Randi,  Wow, when I  logged in today and saw you both talking to ME, it was a very weird feeling and I was on the edge of tears for a moment.  But wonderfully awesome to have you with me!  I am a clinical social worker and work as a therapist, used to work for San Diego Hospice.  It is strange being on the other side.   Randi, good to hear they could get you in sooner - this waiting is hard to do!  But - congrats to your sister!!!!  Ugh, Nancy - second round...sorry to hear that.  I am really strongly considering the bi because of the ILC...I dont want to do this again! Hugs all around!  Pamela
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2011 09:57PM artiecat wrote: Randi, I am so sorry to hear your news!  You are right - life is so precious and life is full of the unknown.  It does remind us to hang in and keep fighting - we do have a choice!  Sending loving, caring thoughts to you and your family.  Pamela

Posts.Content: May 18, 2011 08:13PM artiecat wrote: I have #3 0f 6 TAC plus neulasta next week.  Felt nauseated but only had to take a few of the zofran.  The mj can help with the nausea.  I have, however, developed a nasty rash on my upper chest - onc thinks it may be a reaction to the taxotere and may have to change the protocol next time.  I see a dermatologist on Friday. This is totally doable.  Best to you!!!!
